data.title: SimpleAudioEngine pauseBackgroundMusic() different behavior on windows
data.body:
Steps:
- Pause music: CocosDenshion::SimpleAudioEngine::getInstance()->pauseBackgroundMusic();
- Check if music is playing: if(CocosDenshion::SimpleAudioEngine::getInstance()->isBackgroundMusicPlaying()) 

Result: On Windows Phone isBackgroundMusicPlaying return true. Android and iOS return false.

Tested on windows phone project (proj.win8.1-universal) with cocos2d-x v3.7.

milestone.title: v3.7.1
milestone.description:
This version is about to release with Cocos v2.3.2.
The core feature is Skeleton Animation support for Cocos Studio
It will provide Skeleton Animation for TimelineAction, its cpp/json parser, Lua/JS bindings,  web implementation.

data.title: Made SocketIO events correctly fired when compile in release mode
data.body:
Fixed https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/13248

Reason: `ScriptingCore::executeJSFunctionWithThisObj` is somehow broken in release mode.

Solution: Use `JSFunctionWrapper` to manage callbacks instead of managing JS values manually.

I also did the following in this commit:
- Correct the coding style in jsb_socketio.cpp
- Remove android.mk in the Xcode project

data.title: [AUTO][ci skip]: updating cocos2dx_files.json
Support hexagonal tile maps
data.body:
I'm trying to make game with hexagonal tile map, but I found hex maps in cocos2d-x not working so good.

1)First time i create map in TiledMapEditor(0.12.3):
in Tiled: https://i.imgur.com/bBuGnPq.png3
But cocos2d-x drawing it not exactly.

How it looks in cocos2d-x:
In Cocos2d-x: https://i.imgur.com/GlYe3II.jpg3

2)Another map with Stagger Axis Y and Drawing Offset Y
in Tiled: https://i.imgur.com/bpaqqEk.png3

In Cocos2d-x: https://i.imgur.com/juJpzx2.jpg4

Are there any plans to do full support hexagonal maps in cocos2d-x?

I'am trying to fix this in my branch:
https://github.com/JustVic/cocos2d-x/tree/jv_cocos2d-x
can send a “pull request”.

I solve second case, and Stagger Axis Y and X and Drawing Offset is working. but not solve first because it needs to rewrite rendering order. And Hex map in cocos test need to be updated Tile Side Lenght(Hex);
Working examples screenshots:
1 - https://i.imgur.com/Xo2wzkr.jpg
2 - https://i.imgur.com/mRWZdxd.jpg

data.title: Use GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP for OpenGL version less 3.0
data.body:
glGenerateMipmap supports:
OpenGL ES 2.0 or greater
https://www.khronos.org/opengles/sdk/docs/man3/html/glGenerateMipmap.xhtml
OpenGL 3.0 or greater
https://www.opengl.org/sdk/docs/man/html/glGenerateMipmap.xhtml

Add Configuration::supportsGenerateMipmap() for check it
Add Texture2D::setAutoGenerateMipmap for use old GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP (
need set before glTexImage2D ), and use it any initWithImage

GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP  -
https://www.opengl.org/wiki/Common_Mistakes#Automatic_mipmap_generation

data.body:
Gets filename extension is a suffix (separated from the base filename by
a dot) in lower case.

More code need get filename extension, everyone does it differently.
use check UPPER and lower case, use . and no(example ".csb", ".CSB",
"csb" )

And bag in AudioEngineImpl: find point from left( ext =
strchr(filePath.c_str(), '.'); )
If file path contains point. always unsupported media type

data.title: Physics issues when scene is moved/scaled (v3.7)
data.body:
When scene is moved/scaled physics node positioning is broken. To replicate in 
cocos2d-x-3.7\tests\cpp-tests\classes\physicstest\physicstest.cpp function PhysicsDemo::init() add 
this->setPosition(Vec2(-24.0f, -24.0f)) before return. Navigate to Node: Physics and then to Physics Test - multitouch to add grossini. Click Toggle debug to turn debug draw on. Observe how the debug draw is full width of image (48px rather then 24px) off. At some point moving and scaling scene may change relative position of objects, and in extreme cases actually position images outside of the edge node and completely break physics.
Works correctly in v3.3
Might be related to https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/12943 (but adjusted for position)
